subject: RE: [junit] where there has abstract method in interface
msgSnippet: All methods in interfaces are already abstract. That means they must be implemented in concrete classes that implement the interface. Putting the keyword
messageBody:
All methods in interfaces are already abstract. That means they must be
implemented in concrete classes that implement the interface. Putting
the keyword 'abstract' in the method definition of the interface is not
required, but it doesn't hurt anything.







-----Original Message-----
From: junit@yahoogroups.com [mailto:junit@yahoogroups.com] On Behalf Of
hxd07
Sent: Friday, June 17, 2005 7:45 PM
To: junit@yahoogroups.com
Subject: [junit] where there has abstract method in interface



Hi all.
When I see the junit source code.I see about this:

public interface Test {
public abstract int countTestCases();
public abstract void run(TestResult result);
}

I know that abstract method used in abstract class.But why
it exist in interface.
